intro: Claytonia arkansana, commonly known as the Arkansas springbeauty, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland areas. The plant produces small, delicate white or pink flowers with five petals, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, giving them a silvery appearance. Claytonia arkansana is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments, thriving in the understory of forests.
